content.description: Start on the same ledge as Wilford's Wretch, but before the big move to the jug, traverse left and link into the Deadmans Harley V8 on the left arete.
content.protection: Crash pads and a good spotter.
content.location: Located on Wilford's Wretch boulder, visible from the roundabout.

content.description: A great problem located on Wilford's Wretch boulder. Start in the crack and work your way slightly right in crimps and pockets. Throw to the large jug. Brave enough for the top-out? Me neither.
content.protection: Crash pads (plural) and a good spotter.
content.location: The start is located on the overhanging face that can be seen from the roundabout. Start in the crack.

content.description: The sit down start version of Deadmans Harley V8. This route is located on the left arete of Wilford's Wretch boulder. Several small crimps separate the sit start holds from the generous ledge at head height marking the start of DMH.Â  One of these little crimps may have been created by gunfire, the bullets striking the rock left divots and if memory serves me a tiny crimp making this line possible. Silly red neck games....
content.protection: Crash pads and a good spotter.
content.location: Located on the overhanging face that can be seen from the roundabout off the Cedar Mountain road.

content.description: Start on a rail a little above head height on the left arete. Slap for a sloper, and proceed to top out. Fun route!
content.protection: Crash pads and a good spotter.
content.location: Located on Wilford's Wretch boulder, which can be seen from the roundabout.
